metadata.title: CVE-2019-7283 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in rcp in NetKit through 0.17. For an rcpoperation, the server chooses which files/directories are sent to theclient. However, the rcp client only performs cursory validation of theobject name returned. A malicious rsh server (or Man-in-The-Middleattacker) can overwrite arbitrary files in a directory on the rcp clientmachine. This is similar to CVE-2019-6111.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rsh-client - 0.17-21
rsh-server - 0.17-21
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: netkit-rsh package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17-21').
